panels.content:
COVID-19 – Romanian Economic Impact Monitor

Impact of the coronavirus pandemic on the Romanian economy: facts and forecasts
RO  HU  EN
433 days passed since the first coronavirus case in Romania and currently there are 27 265 active cases.

panels.description:
🕑 Updated at 10:34 on 3 May 2021  
  
Infection incidence rates (new case total of last 14 days/1000 people - with 17 to 3 days before the date displayed) per settlement (territorial administrative unit UAT)  
  
📊 [data.gov.ro](https://data.gov.ro/dataset/transparenta-covid)
panels.title: Infection rates by settlement 📆 3 May 2021

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "base"."vaccine1" WHERE ("lang" =~ /^$lang$/ AND ("type" = 'total_immunized' OR "type" = 'total_first')) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "langtype" fill(null)

panels.content:
A research project carried out by researchers of the Faculty of Economics and Business Administration of the Babeș-Bolyai University (Cluj-Napoca, Romania), which includes the daily publication of data on the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic in Romania. Interactive infographics refreshed on a daily basis are meant to offer a comprehensive and relevant picture about the current state of the Romanian economy.
The purpose of our website is to offer support for economic and policy decision makers in Romania by providing a precise and regularly updated analysis of the current situation caused by COVID-19, and by offering background studies for the development of forecasting scenarios with the aim to better protect society, employees, companies and supply chains

panels.description:

panels.description:
First vaccine doses administered by vaccine type (positive axis) and people immunized by vaccine type (negative axis)

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "base"."vaccine1" WHERE ("lang" =~ /^$lang$/ AND ("type" = 'total_administered' OR "type" = 'total_administered_astra_zeneca' OR "type" = 'total_administered_pfizer' OR "type" = 'total_administered_moderna')) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "langtype" fill(null)

panels.title: First vaccine doses administered (+) and people immunized (-)

panels.description: 📊 Own estimation, refreshes weekly
panels.title: Short-term forecast of daily new coronavirus cases

Evolution of infection rates per county (new case total of last 14 days/1000 people)  
📊 [Știri Oficiale - COVID-19](https://stirioficiale.ro/), Own estimation
panels.title: Evolution of infection rates per county (new case total of last 14 days/1000 people)

panels.description: All data is from the official government sources. Active cases is a calculated metric. Active cases (own estimation) is the cumulative total of the new cases from the last 14 days. Active cases (official) is the sum of Deaths and Recoveries substracted from the Total Cases. 📊 [Știri Oficiale - COVID-19](https://stirioficiale.ro/)

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "governance"."governance1" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "/^$lang$/" fill(null)

panels.title: Evolution of cases, recoveries and deaths in total

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "governance"."governance1" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "/^$lang$/" fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") FROM "governance"."governance1" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "/^$lang$/" fill(null)

panels.title: Evolution of cases, recoveries and deaths per day

panels.description:
The positive test ratio is the number of daily new cases divided by the number of daily tests. The mortality rate is the number of daily new deaths divided by the number of daily new cases.  
📊 [Știri Oficiale - COVID-19](https://stirioficiale.ro/), [Johns Hopkins University - CSSE](https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/data/mortality)

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "base"."governance2" WHERE ("lang" =~ /^$lang$/ AND ("type" = 'case/test' OR "type" = 'death_rate')) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "langtype" fill(null)
SELECT moving_average(mean("value"), 14) FROM "base"."governance2" WHERE ("lang" =~ /^$lang$/ AND ("type" = 'death_rate' OR "type" = 'case/test')) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d), "type" fill(null)

panels.title: Positive test ratio and mortality rate

Stringency is a relative indicator between 0 (mild) - 100 (severe).  
📊 [University of Oxford - COVID-19 Government Response Tracker](https://covidtracker.bsg.ox.ac.uk/)
panels.title: Stringency of government measures in Romania and other countries

panels.description:
Stringency is a relative indicator between 0 (mild) - 100 (severe).

panels.title: Population response to government stringency

panels.description:

📊 [University of Oxford - COVID-19 Government Response Tracker](https://covidtracker.bsg.ox.ac.uk/)
panels.title: The decrease in mobility and the evolution of government severity, next to daily new cases

panels.content:
Macroeconomic indicators

Presentation of key macroeconomic indicators

panels.description:
We estimated a dynamic factor model (DFM) to provide short-term economic growth forecasts in a timely manner. DFMs are used to exploit useful information from a wide range of high-frequancy indicators. Our model includes monthly data series covering different economic sectors (market services, industry, construction) as well as sentiment, price and labour market indicators. As more information see the light of day, the GDP growth estimates provided by the DFM are expected to become more accurate. The values shown represent the three-month moving average of the annual growth rate.  
📊 [INS](https://insse.ro/cms/ro), [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/), own calculation
panels.title: Annual GDP growth vs. market and model (DFM) estimates

panels.description:
The heat map summarises and presents the evolution of several key macroeconomic indicators in the latest period  
🟥 worse ◄ 2015-2019 average ► better 🟦
panels.title: Economic heatmap

panels.description:
We estimated a dynamic factor model (DFM) to provide short-term economic growth forecasts in a timely manner. DFMs are used to exploit useful information from a wide range of high-frequancy indicators. Our model includes monthly data series covering different economic sectors (market services, industry, construction) as well as sentiment, price and labour market indicators. As more information see the light of day, the GDP growth estimates provided by the DFM are expected to become more accurate. The values shown represent the three-month moving average of the annual growth rate.  
📊 [INS](https://insse.ro/cms/ro), [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/), own calculation
panels.title: Annual GDP growth vs. market and model (DFM) estimates with uncertainty intervals

panels.content:
Financial market reactions

The main developed and regional stock market index closing prices, returns and volatility. The corresponding values for the critical period of the 2008 crisis for comparison (starting dates 📆 2008-09-16 and 2020-02-26 📆).

📊 [Thomson Reuters Eikon](https://eikon.thomsonreuters.com/index.html)

panels.content:
⛔Severity
🔴Complete shut-down
⭕Partial shut-down
😐Reducing staff number (including furlough)
🏠Home office, flexible hours
💧Hygiene, social distancing
🌡Body temperature tracking
💲Support (e.g. dedicated phone line)
✈Ceasing or limiting business travel
🎈Donation
ℹInforming
✖Others

Industry effects

Expected impact of the coronavirus pandemic on major Romanian industrial sectors

panels.content:
Mobility indicators

Effects of the pandemic on various dimensions of mobility (residential, workplace, transit, shopping, leisure) by county. Because of methodological changes announced by Google, the data are incomplete between 📅 2020.08.17. and 📅 2020.09.11.

panels.description:
Composite index based on Google's mobility data. Is shows the change in mobility of the population, compared to the average between 📅 15th of February - 1st of March. You can change the date using the bottom axis (weekly averages - with week closing dates displayed).  Residential values inverted.  
📊 Own calculation based on data from [Google](https://www.google.com/covid19/mobility/)
panels.title: Evolution of national mobility

panels.description:
Composite index based on Google's mobility data. Is shows the change in mobility of the population, compared to the average between 📅 15th of February - 1st of March. Residential values inverted.  
📊 Own calculation based on data from [Google](https://www.google.com/covid19/mobility/)
panels.title: Change in mobility at county level

panels.description:
Components of the mobility index based on Google's data. Is shows the change in mobility of the population, compared to the average between 📅 15th of February - 1st of March 2020 and the change in border crossings compared to the same date in 2019.  
📊 Own calculation based on data from [Google](https://www.google.com/covid19/mobility/), [Romanian Border Police](https://www.politiadefrontiera.ro/ro/main/n-date-deschise-17/?fy=2019&page_no=1&fm=4)
panels.title: Change in mobility across various domains

panels.description:
Mobility index based on Google's data. Is shows the change in mobility of the population in this domain, compared to the average between 📅 15th of February - 1st of March, normalized for each day of the week.  
📊 Own calculation based on data from [Google](https://www.google.com/covid19/mobility/)
panels.title: Time spent at home

panels.content:
Real estate market

Average real estate prices and number of real estate transactions in the largest cities, as well as on country and county levels. The corresponding values for the critical period of the 2008 crisis for comparison (starting dates 📆 December 2019 and 📆 June 2008).
